intro: Aretia pubescens subsp. hirtella, commonly known as the hairy aretia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in dense clusters. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
